markdownRemark.html:
Some of the topics we’ll be discussing include:

  • The “Work on Climate” community and its goal
  • The guide “Climate Justice 101” and the reasons for creating it
  • The different definitions of climate justice
  • The risk that technology perpetuates climate injustice
  • Intersectional environmentalism as an imperative to the fight against climate change
  • What we can do to integrate climate justice into our projects
  • Data justice and equity

References:

  • Climate Justice Guide 101
  • Work on Climate Starter Packs
  • H. Moore & J.K. Russell, Organizing Cools the Planet
  • BlocPower
  • GreenWave
  • Dr. Ayana Elizabeth Johnson, "How to Save a Planet"
  • WeACT

On positionality and climate justice as a personal practice in community:

  • On positionality
  • Bad Activist Collective
  • "My Role in a Social Change Ecosystem" by Deepa Iyer
  • "Pod Mapping" for accountability by Mia Mingus
  • "Everything worthwhile is done with other people" -- Mariame Kaba
  • A few climate communities with members from tech: Work On Climate, Climate Action Tech, Terra.do
  • Daily practice: Anti-Racism Daily, "Practical Decolonization: How to live it daily" workshop

On data (in)justice and the dangers of uncritical tech and data in climate:

  • Data Harm Record of harms from data and algorithms from the Data Justice Lab
  • "False solutions" to climate change (here's a short sample)
  • Data Capitalism interactive from Data 4 Black Lives
  • “Decolonizing Methodologies: 20 Years On” annual lecture by Professor Linda Tuhiwai Smith

On the importance of intersectional climate justice:

  • Intersectional Environmentalism by Leah Thomas
  • Who Killed Berta Cáceres?
  • "Indigenous sovereignty could save the planet"

Principles aligning across movements:

  • A Just Transition Framework from the Climate Justice Alliance
  • Design Justice Principles (disponible également en français)

frontmatter.title: Introduction to Climate Justice
frontmatter.description: In this podcast, we talk and learn about Climate Justice with Richard Kim and Yang Hong from the community Work on Climate.
